author: Andy Harris
title: Sports Notes
text: The Suburbanite.com assistant editor Posted Oct. 11, 2015 at 11:00 AM - Green senior goalie Haleigh Seman tied the program's record for career shutouts with eight saves in a 1-0 win over Wooster. It was the second straight shutout for Seman, who also blanked Nordonia 1-0 in the Bulldogs' previous game. Senior Marisa Lovell tallied Green's lone goal against the Knights. - Seven different players scored a goal and the goalkeeping duo of Owen Humbert and Caleb Bower pitched a shutout in goal as Lake Center Christian routed Garrettsville 7-0 to remain undefeated in Portage Trail Conference play. Stephen Radonjich and Tim Kurczewski each had a goal and an assist for the Tigers. - The doubles team of Maria and Ava Zivick placed fourth at the Canton Division I sectional tournament to advance to the district tournament held in Oberlin. - Springfield senior James Williams used a strong finish to pull away from the pack and win the Columbiana Clipper Invitational. Williams helped lead the Spartans to a second-place finish in the 13-team field. The Springfield girls team, led by freshman Hannah Brost, placed fifth in the event. - Senior goalie Joey Daniels recorded seven saves, but Manchester could not find the back of the net for a goal of its own in a 1-0 loss to Chippewa. - Allyssa Kechner had 13 kills and Reigan Vargo added 38 assists as Lake Center Christian survived a tough test from Rootstown in a five-set, non-league volleyball win. - Joe Zwick and Conner Delahanty placed third and fourth individually to pace Lake boys cross country to a fifth-place finish at the Stark County Championships. - Julia Karmie made six saves in goal and Gianna Skeriotis scored Lake Center Christian's lone goal in an 8-1 loss to Garrettsville. - Zach Hillman and Kyle Genetin tallied first-half goals for Green as the Bulldogs held on for a 2-1 win over Canfield to run their record to 13-0. - Haley Akers had 14 kills, but it wasn't quite enough as Coventry fell to Rittman in four sets in a non-league volleyball match. - Jacob Ickes placed 26th overall in the Division II/III field with a time of 18:58.7 to lead Lake Center Christian at the Stark County Cross Country Championships. Freshman Eliz Slabaugh placed 18th with a time of 21:34.2 for LCCS in the girls race.
